author: Special Correspondent
text:
This new second line is part of Villupuram-Dindigul doubling project

Commissioner of Railway Safety S.K. Mittal (centre), inspecting the newly laid second railway line in the Tiruchi- Manapparai broad gauge section.— Photo: A.Muralitharan

Commissioner of Railway Safety, Southern Circle, Bengaluru S.K. Mittal commenced his two-day statutory inspection on the new second railway line laid between Tiruchi and Manapparai as part of the doubling project.

He set out on the mission travelling in a motor trolley from Tiruchi to Samudhram inspecting the newly laid track, bridges, curvatures and over head electrification to ensure whether the works were carried out as per desired standards.

Chief Project Manager, Rail Vikas Nigam Limited (RVNL), Chennai Pradeep Gaur, Madurai Divisional Railway Manager S.K. Garg and other senior railway officers accompanied him.

Sources said the CRS would set out on a motor trolley inspection in the remaining stretch from Samudram to Manapparai on Friday. Thereafter, he would carry out a high speed trial run from Samudram to Tiruchi travelling in an Inspection Special.

The Tiruchi – Manapparai new second line is part of the Villupuram – Dindigul doubling project being executed by the RVNL.
title: CRS inspects second line between Tiruchi and Manapparai
